alert.note: Alert for Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 3:28PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central King and Queen and southeastern King William Counties through 415 PM EST... At 327 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Kent, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... King William, King And Queen Court House, Saint Stephens Church, Stevensville, Cohoke, Walkerton, Rose Garden, Lanesville, Crouch, Henley Fork, Palls, Cooke and Bruington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Western King and Queen
